page.title: 14ELM COTTAGE, STOKE FLEMING
page.content: {Elm Cottage}is right in the middle of the village of{Stoke Fleming. We cannot use our front door because it goes straight onto the main road. In fact the cottage sticks out into the road. In the summer it is a constant traffic jam of{holidaymaker's cars and very dangerous. We have to use the back door all the time. When the cottage was built{300 years ago the main street was a muddy track and the only traffic was{horses and {carts.}The cottage had a{thatched roof until about 25 years ago when it was changed to slates which will last longer. We have two bedrooms,two living rooms,a kitchen,a bathroom, a laundry room and a small yard at the back. Before we bought it they wanted to{knock the cottage down}to make the road wider which would be a shame.
